content: in back worked through the back loop from here on crown r1 work the stitches as they appear to first increase marker * m1r sm k1 p1 k1 p1 k1 m1l work the stitches as they appear to the next marker repeat from * to end of round increase 8 8 stitches r2 work all the stitches in the round as they appear working the previous round s increases as knit stitches r3 repeat round 1 r4 * k1 p1 repeat from * to end of round working the previous round s increases as purl stitches work rounds 1-4 a total of 7 9 times until there are 144 184 stitches on the needles or to desired width the size can be easily adjusted by adjusting the number of increases worked but round 4 must be the last round worked before continuing onto the body body continue working in 1x1 rib k1 p1 across the round until the piece measures just short of 13 from the cast-on edge remove the increase markers at any time binding off the tubular bind-off is an intermediate technique with a sewn edge if you don t feel quite ready to tackle it skip the next steps and head to the beginner adaptation section otherwise continue below work 4 setup rounds as follows r1 * k1 sl1wyif repeat from * to end of round r2 * sl1wyib p1 repeat from * to end of round r3-4 repeat rounds 1 and 2 after completing the setup rounds bind off the stitches using the 1x1 tubular bind-off technique also known as the italian bind-off a tutorial can be found here https //www instagram com/reel/csmt5gmpprv/ beginner adaptation there are many other bind-off techniques that allow for a stretchy edge while the tubular bind-off is virtually unmatched in seamlessness and elasticity you can achieve a good fit nevertheless with techniques such as jenny s surprisingly stretchy bind-off the k2togtbl bind-off or even binding off in pattern while paying careful attention to gauge the best recommendation i can give is to do an online search for stretchy bind-off techniques and try the one that works best for you happy knitting if
